article.headline: Chicago St. 79, Bethune-Cookman 64
article.story: HOFFMAN ESTATES, Ill. -- David Holston scored 34 points, hitting seven 3-pointers Friday as Chicago State beat Bethune-Cookman 79-64 in the Chicago Invitational Challenge. The 5-foot-8 Holston was 12-of-18 on field goals, including 7-for-12 on 3-pointers, and also had 10 assists and seven steals for Chicago State (3-2). John Cantrell added 17 points for the Cougars. Bethune-Cookman (1-4) got 23 points from C.J. Reed. Mike Wilson's 3-pointer just before the buzzer sent Chicago State to a 40-21 halftime lead. Holston finished the first half with 16 points, making 3-of-6 on 3-pointers, and also had five assists and five steals. He hit two more 3-pointers in a 12-2 spurt opening the second half as Chicago State went up by 31 early in the second half. Reed hit a pair of 3-pointers and Stanley Elliott's tip-in rallied Bethune-Cookman as the Wildcats cut the lead to 11 in the closing minutes -- as close as they would get.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
